    • Method Detail

      • moveFile

        public static String moveFile(String sourceFilePath,
                              Object... toPathSegments)
        Moves a file, residing in one directory to a destination file or directory. Refer to the documentation for move(Path,Path,boolean,boolean).
        Parameters:
        sourceFilePath - the absolute or relative path to the file to move
        toPathSegments - a destination directory and/or file name to move to. If the path does not exist and the final segment in the path does not contain a file extension or ends in a file separator ("\" in Windows, "/" in Linux) then the destination is treated as directory. If you have dynamic elements to the path you can pass each segment as a separate parameters, e.g. move("myfile.dat", "archive", year, month). If a path segment is not a String then toString() is applied to the segment.
        Returns:
        the path of the moved file

      • moveDirectoryFile

        public static String moveDirectoryFile(String sourceDir,
                                       String sourceFile,
                                       Object... destinationPath)
        Moves a file, residing in one directory to a destination file or directory. Refer to the documentation for moveFile(String,Object...).
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - the source directory
        sourceFile - the source file name
        destinationPath - the destination file or directory
        Returns:
        the path of the moved file

      • move

        public static Path move(Path source,
                        Path destination,
                        boolean destinationIsDirectory,
                        boolean allowReplaceExisting)
        Moves a file to a destination file or directory. The move is performed atomically unless the underlying file system does not support atomic moves. All required directories are created before the file is moved. If the file already exists in the destination directory then a numeric suffix is added to the file (before the extension). For example, if order.dat already exists then order_1.dat will be created. If that file exists too then the suffix will be incremented, and so on (up to 100).
        Parameters:
        source - the file to be moved
        destination - the destination file or directory
        destinationIsDirectory - if true the destination is treated as directory
        allowReplaceExisting - if true an existing file can be replaced
        Returns:
        the path of the moved file
